title: FLIP - Focus Timer for Study
summary: measures study time when flipping phone over; tracks and visualises study time; also sets challenges; tries to schedule tasks (e.g. 'practice grammar') in empty spots in calendar
reviews: Amazing!! I love this app!! I have ADHD and this really helps when I study to motivate me to get a good 'focus score'. It has a premium, but even without it I have been able to see my study progress, set goals, and use the community feature. Only thing I don't really like it the abundance of that community feature. It's just a bit much but if you like studying with friends go for it. Definitely recommend.

title: Goodtime productivity timer
summary: work timer which disables sound and internet connectivity during work sessions
reviews: I have ADHD and use this at work (mindless office job) to help me focus. I like the minimalist app design. I feel that the Start/End session could be improved upon. It lacks an effective visual cue at the end of a session. For completed focus sessions, a count-up timer for additional focus time would be helpful (e.g. missed "End Session" notif / locked in). These would be game-changers for reducing distractions.

title: GoOffline
summary: block phone from being used (except for emergency calls) for session of specific length, after certain amount of time has been spent on phone, or during specific hours
reviews:
This app works almost exactly how I need it to, with one huge problem. I 
use this app to help manage my ADHD. I also use alarms throughout the day. 
The problem is that when I've locked myself out of my phone, I can't 
dismiss these alarms!! So they go off for 30 minutes before my phone 
automatically dismisses it. I would also like a feature that shows how much 
time you've used, either as a widget or displayed on the lock screen.

title: Lock Me Out ðŸ¥‡ Freedom from phone addiction
summary: block apps (blacklist or white list) or entire device, for specific session, during specific hours, or when used certain amount of time; also monitor usage and display statistics
reviews: Only thing that helps me not waste my whole day having adhd

title: Off the Grid - Digital Detox
summary: Block phone access according to a timer or a schedule; sends auto-replies to others trying to get in touch; important contacts can be added to whitelist to let their calls through; make virtual payment of $1 to override and unlock phone.
reviews: I love this app and use it to help me stay accountable. I have ADHD, so i use the schedule options to help me stay on task and on time getting out the door and then build in deep work sessions manually throughout the day. I rarely try to end a session early, feeling that kinda defeats my purposes for the app for in the first place, but the few times I did, I didn't encounter issues. It's definitely one of my go-to tools for adhd focus and productivity support!

title: RescueTime Time Management
summary: track and visualise time spent in apps, websites, and phone calls; automatically categorised; weekly summary reports; premium version offers FocusTime distraction blocker (block websites on desktop; silence sound and notifications on mobile); get alerts when too much time is spent on distractions, or encouragement when goals are hit
reviews: Compared to other products, the thing I miss the most is some kind of adhd mode : a lifecoach for persons who have a difficult time to oganzize their time. Auto enable focus time. Auto warnings when we should stop playing on the phone when we should sleep (no sleep schedule) No tracking tasks Vs what I'm actually doing (playing on ticktock) These functions are important for anything having a difficult time to organise themselves.

title: SPACE - Find your phone/life balance
summary: tracks and visualises global time spent; set reminders if the user is on their phone for longer than X minutes or unlocks her phone too frequently; can dim the screen when limit is hit; can set goals and track progress against them ('unlock achievements to build a galaxy as you hit your goals'), or against other users; can also mute notifications during specific hours; also 'understand what user you are' ("boredom battler, social sticky-mitt, rabbit hole wanderer or busy bee"); can also block apps
reviews: This is a brilliant app. I have noticed a correlation between my own mental decline and my tendency to lie in bed staring endlessly at my phone. I have tried many, but this one is the best. It provides gentle reminders that are effective and not irritating. The result is that I am more present, more productive, I read more, and I sleep better. Thanks SPACE! Edit: I do wish that there was an option for more screen unlocks. As someone with ADHD I unlock my phone 4 or 5 times for one task.
